page.description: This procedure is part of the Web Component Builder procedure for building a component.

step.description: In the Connection type list select "Access Database".
Click 'open folder' icon to navigate to and select the Microsoft Access (.MDB) database file.
Click Connect. If Alpha Anywhere was able to open the database, additional fields will appear on the dialog box.
Continue with Retrieving Your Data From a Table or View.
Select how to retrieve data. The options are:

section.title: Retrieve Your Data from a Table
section.description: If you selected "Table or View" in step 6:

step.description: Click the 'down' icon to select a table or view from the Table/View list.
step.note: A table alias can make your grid portable, by separating it from direct reference to a table name. as long as a table has the same structure and the same alias, it can use a grid originally built for another table.

step.description: Optionally, enter an alias for the table into the Table/View alias field. If you do not enter an alias, it will default to the name of the table.
Optionally, click Define Arguments to display the Define Arguments dialog. You use arguments to provide run-time values for filter and order expressions.
Optionally, specify a filter expression in the Filter field that selects records from the table. Click the '...' icon to display the Specify Filter dialog. Refer to Specifying a Filter Expression.
Optionally, specify a ordering expression in the Order by field that sequences selected records. Click the '...' icon to display the Specify Order dialog. Refer to Specifying an Order Expression.
Optionally, check Read only to prevent user updates. If you are in the process of creating a grid, continue with Selecting the Fields to Display.
Click Select Primary Key(s) to display the Specify Primary Keys dialog. Select the field(s) that uniquely identify each record and click OK.

section.title: Retrieving Your Data with a SQL Statement
section.description: If you selected to retrieve your data with a "SQL Select Statement":

case.description: Click Edit SQL to display the SQL Builder to define the table(s) and fields that you want to work with. Continue with SQL Builder.
